Package com.niton.frames

Class CustomFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • com.niton.frames.CustomFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class CustomFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The Custom Frame is A JFrame using a Theme defined by you or a predefined Theme.
    A theme is meant to provide a border for the frame
    The theme is not changeable later on
    Version:
    2018-08-08
    Author:
    Nils
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isMaximized

        public boolean isMaximized()
        Description :
        Checks if the frame fits the normal are exclusive the taskbar.
        Maybe not works perfect on any Linux system, because the don't offer a good task bar implementation
        Returns:
        if the frame is as big as the OS allows for normal frames (exclusive taskbar)
